marketNews.title: Wholesales Mobil -11% YoY pada Januari 2025, Motor -6% YoY
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that national wholesale car sales in January 2025 reached 61,843 units (‑11.3% YoY, ‑22.5% MoM), representing 6.8‑8.24% of the 2025 target of 750,000‑900,000 units set by Gaikindo. Astra International (ASII) recorded wholesale sales of Toyota at 22,082 units (+5.2% YoY, ‑17% MoM) and Daihatsu at 9,983 units (‑31% YoY, ‑24% MoM) in January 2025. Combined, the two main brands of ASII showed a decline of ‑9.3% YoY and ‑19% MoM, better than the industry average (‑11% YoY, ‑23% MoM), resulting in a combined market share increase to 51.8% in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 49.8%, January 2024: 50.7%). The main competitor Honda posted the relatively best performance with wholesale sales of 7,276 units in January 2025 (‑14% YoY, ‑13% MoM), raising its market share to 11.8% (vs. December 2024: 10.5%). Mitsubishi, another major competitor, recorded the worst performance with sales falling (‑44% YoY, ‑47% MoM) to 5,028 units. BYD reported wholesale sales of 1,114 units in January 2025 (‑29% MoM) and a cumulative 16,543 units since its first delivery in June 2024. Although monthly sales declined, BYD’s average monthly wholesale volume since June 2024 (~2,067 units) remains above Hyundai’s (~1,816 units). Hyundai recorded wholesale sales of 2,308 units in January 2025 (‑23% YoY, +26% MoM). Gaikindo Chairman Jongkie Sugiarto said the association maintains its 2025 car sales projection of at least 900,000 units, about 4% higher YoY than the 2024 wholesale result. The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded domestic motorcycle sales of 557,191 units in January 2025 (‑6% YoY, +38% MoM), representing 8.3‑8.7% of the 2025 AISI target of 6.4‑6.7 million units.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The decline in both car and motorcycle sales may indicate weak consumer purchasing power at the beginning of 2025. Going forward, investors should monitor wholesale figures for February and March 2025, as historically vehicle sales before the Lebaran period (approximately March 31‑April 1, 2025) tend to be strong. Although the 2025 sales target does not show a significant increase, additional catalysts are deemed necessary for the automotive sales target to be achieved.

tickerNews.title: Astra International (ASII) wholesales performance January 2025
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) recorded wholesale sales of Toyota at 22,082 units (+5.2% YoY, ‑17% MoM) and Daihatsu at 9,983 units (‑31% YoY, ‑24% MoM) in January 2025. Combined, the two main brands of ASII showed a decline of ‑9.3% YoY and ‑19% MoM, better than the industry average (‑11% YoY, ‑23% MoM), resulting in a combined market share increase to 51.8% in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 49.8%, January 2024: 50.7%).

tickerNews.title: ASII shares decline following wholesales data
tickerNews.content: Responding to the wholesale data, automotive stocks such as ASII (-1.72%), IMAS (-1.25%), AUTO (-3.22%), DRMA (-0.54%), and MPMX (-1.04%) fell in price during trading on Monday (10/2).

tickerNews.content: Responding to the wholesale data, automotive stocks such as ASII (-1.72%), IMAS (-1.25%), AUTO (-3.22%), DRMA (-0.54%), and MPMX (-1.04%) fell in price during trading on Monday (10/2).

tickerNews.title: Petrosea (PTRO) commissioner purchases 800,000 shares
tickerNews.content: Commissioner of Petrosea, Erwin Ciputra, bought 800,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 3,143.75 rupiah per share on 7 February 2025. The total transaction value reached 2.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Erwin Ciputra’s ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0779% to 0.0858%.

tickerNews.title: Indosat (ISAT) 4Q24 net profit and operational results
tickerNews.content: Indosat reported a net profit of 1.03 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (‑40% YoY, ‑10% QoQ). This made the 2024 net profit 4.9 trillion rupiah (+9% YoY), below expectations at 94% of consensus. Operating profit in 4Q24 was 2.4 trillion rupiah (‑13% YoY, ‑11% QoQ), leading to a 2024 operating profit of 10.8 trillion rupiah (+16% YoY), also below consensus at 96% of estimate. Average revenue per user (ARPU) for the mobile segment rose to 38.9 thousand rupiah (+1% YoY, +5% QoQ), while the subscriber base fell to 94.7 million (‑4% YoY, ‑4% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) plans 2.8 trillion rupiah bond issuance
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold intends to issue bonds worth 2.8 trillion rupiah to refinance existing debt. The issuance will consist of Series A bonds of 856 billion rupiah (7.25% annual interest, 367‑day tenor) and Series B bonds of 1.94 trillion rupiah (8.75% annual interest, 3‑year tenor). The bonds have received an idA+ rating from Pefindo. The public offering period is 19‑20 February 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) launches Bale super app
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara officially launched the super app named Bale by BTN on Sunday (9/2). President Director Nixon L. P. Napitupulu said the app aims to increase transactions through digitalization. Since its introduction, Bale by BTN has accumulated 2.3 million users, targeting about 3.6‑4 million users by the end of 2025 and over 5 million by 2026. BBTN allocated a capex of 1 trillion rupiah for 2025 (vs. 900 billion rupiah in 2024) for digital transformation.

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi International (MEDC) starts commercial operation of Ijen geothermal plant
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi International, through its subsidiary PT Medco Cahaya Geothermal, announced the commercial start of the Ijen geothermal power plant in East Java. The plant is planned to have a total capacity of 110 MW, with an initial phase of 35 MW. Ijen has a 30‑year power purchase agreement and is expected to supply electricity to approximately 85,000 households in the Java‑Bali system.

tickerNews.title: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna (HMSP) 4Q24 sales volume
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna reported a sales volume of 20.3 billion sticks in 4Q24 (‑1.1% YoY, ‑1.9% QoQ). This brought the 2024 sales volume down to 80.8 billion sticks (‑3.7% YoY). Industry‑wide sales in Indonesia reached 74.1 billion sticks in 4Q24 (+1.9% YoY, ‑1.9% QoQ) and 295.5 billion sticks in 2024 (+1.1% YoY). HMSP’s market share fell to 27.4% in 2024 (vs. 28.7% in 2023) but remained stable at 27.3‑27.4% during 2Q24‑4Q24. In the product segment, cigarette sales declined 4.5% YoY to 79.6 billion sticks, while IQOS sales grew roughly two‑fold to 1.2 billion sticks.

tickerNews.title: Timah (TINS) targets 2025 net profit and dividend payout
tickerNews.content: Timah’s corporate secretary, Rendi Kurniawan, said the company targets a net profit of around 1‑1.5 trillion rupiah in 2025, with revenue projected at 12‑13 trillion rupiah. The 2025 target is driven by increased resources, tin reserves, and new mine openings. Production capacity of tin ore and tin metal sales are expected to rise by 10‑20% YoY in 2025. Timah also plans to distribute 2024 dividends with an estimated payout ratio of 30‑35%.

tickerNews.title: Harum Energy (HRUM) 2025 capex allocation
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy’s corporate secretary, Renny Soependi, stated that the company will allocate about 400 million US dollars in capex for 2025 (vs. 687 million US dollars in 2024), mainly for nickel ore mining operations and the completion of the HPAL smelter project. The HPAL smelter is expected to start contributing to HRUM’s performance as early as late 2025 or early 2026.

tickerNews.title: Brigit Biofarmaka (OBAT) new factory to triple sales
tickerNews.content: The CEO of Brigit Biofarmaka Teknologi, Is Heriyanto, said the company will inaugurate a new factory in Sukoharjo, Central Java in mid‑February 2025. The facility is targeted to generate up to 250 billion rupiah in annual revenue, potentially tripling the company’s sales. The plant will produce herbal supplement products in capsule strip, blister, bottle, and liquid forms, packaged in sachets or bottles.

tickerNews.title: Dian Swastatika Sentosa (DSSA) obtains 1 trillion rupiah credit facility
tickerNews.content: Dian Swastatika Sentosa received a credit facility of up to 1 trillion rupiah from Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI). The funds will be used for general purposes, including operations and subsidiary development.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources (BUMI) announces death of IR and Secretary
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources announced that its Investor Relations Director and Corporate Secretary, Dileep Srivastava, passed away on Saturday (8/2).

tickerNews.title: Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) statement on Jiwasraya case
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia stated that the appointment of a suspect in the Jiwasraya financial management and fund case (2008‑2018) concerning its commissioner, Isa Rachmatarwata, is unrelated to his role as a commissioner of the company. The case is linked to his position as Head of the Insurance Bureau at the Capital Market and Financial Institution Supervisory Agency from 2006‑2012.

tickerNews.title: Pengendali Jaya Trishindo (HELI) purchase by PT Startel Communication
tickerNews.content: PT Startel Communication bought approximately 55.3 million HELI shares at an average price of 287 rupiah per share on 31 January 2025. The transaction value was about 15.9 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Startel’s ownership in HELI increased from 23.05% to 29.69%.

tickerNews.title: Duta Anggada Realty (DART) sale by commissioner
tickerNews.content: Hartadi Angkosubroto, the Commissioner and Principal of Duta Anggada Realty, sold 27 million DART shares at an average price of 217 rupiah per share on 5 February 2025. The transaction value was about 5.8 billion rupiah. After the sale, his ownership in DART decreased from 47.51% to 46.65%.
